**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 42 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 [Falrok](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1573) **Source** [Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City](/Sources.aspx?ID=13) pg. 46 **Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +29, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +24, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +27, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +27, [Saggorak Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +24, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +29 **Str** +4 **Dex** +8 **Con** +5 **Int** +3 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +6 **Lazurite-Infused Flesh** Falrok's flesh is infused with lazurite, and he gains the benefits [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creatures gain from this mineral at all times. When in an area infused with lazurite, such as the Sanctum of the Starved, these benefits increase to a +3 circumstance bonus to saving throws against [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) effects. This infusion also grants Falrok his resistance to positive damage. --- **AC** 37 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +29 **Will** +23 +3 status to all saves vs. [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) **HP** 250 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) 15 **Stench** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246)) 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn there must succeed at a DC 34 Fortitude save or become [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (plus [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
**Opportune Backstab** **Trigger** A creature within Falrok's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of his allies. **Effect** When Falrok's enemy is hit by one of his allies, he capitalizes upon the distraction, making a Strike against the triggering creature. --- **Speed** 30 feet, burrow 20 feet **Melee** jaws +30 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 3d8+12 piercing plus ghast fever and paralysis **Melee** claw +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 3d6+12 slashing plus paralysis **Consume Flesh** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** Falrok is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour. **Effect** Falrok devours a chunk of the corpse and regains 8d6 hit points. He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once. **Ghast Fever** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162)) **Saving Throw** DC 34 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1 day); **Stage 2** 4d8 negative damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89) (1 day); **Stage 3** 4d8 negative damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day); **Stage 4** dead, and rises as a [ghast](/Monsters.aspx?ID=219) the next midnight. **Paralysis** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) Any living creature hit by Falrok's attack must succeed at a DC 34 Fortitude save or become [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28). It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. **[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)** 4d6 precision damage. **Swift Leap** ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) Falrok jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions. **Scoundrel** When Falrok successfully [Feints](/Actions.aspx?ID=48), the target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against melee attacks he attempts against it until the end of his next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of their next turn, not just Falrok's.
